availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: -- I James B, Latimer a resident of the City of Baltimore in the State of Maryland, duly appointed & commissioned by his Excellency The the Governor of the State of Kentucky. a Commissioner of Deeds, under Chapter 70 of the Act of the General Assembly of said Commonwealth Entitled "An act to adopt the Revised statutes" -- approved January 7. 1852, -- investing me with full power and authority to Execute and fulfill the duties of said office --
-- Do Solemnly swear, that I will well and truly Execute and perform all the duties of said office
Taken & Subscribed to the 18th day of Jany AD 1862

Before me
Wm H Hayward. J. P.
Justice of the Peace of the State of Maryland in and for the City of Baltimore

figure.ab:
JAMES B. LATIMER COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS
BALTIMORE

body.p: Having occasion to day to refer to my Commission. I found I had neglected to forward the enclosed, sworn to on the 18t of Jany the day on which I recd the commission

yr respectfully
J B L
8th Mar 62
